PermissibleValues.value: Randomized cohort: Patients without molecular alterations
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Randomization Cohort Patient Without Eligible Molecular Abnormality

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Randomization Cohort Patient Without Eligible Molecular Abnormality
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.: A group of individuals, identified by a common characteristic.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.: A molecular or cytogenic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alkylating-like inorganic platinum agent (cis-diamminedichloroplatinum) with antineoplastic activity. Cisplatin forms highly reactive, charged, platinum complexes which bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links. These cross-links result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.

Concepts.definition: An alkylating-like inorganic platinum agent (cis-diamminedichloroplatinum) with antineoplastic activity. Cisplatin forms highly reactive, charged, platinum complexes which bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links. These cross-links result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.
Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alkylating-like inorganic platinum agent (cis-diamminedichloroplatinum) with antineoplastic activity. These cross-links result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question._Earlier in time or order._A type of cancer treatment that uses testing and medication to more precisely identify and treat cancer. These treatments target and disable genes or proteins necessary to the proliferation of cancer cells.
